<<BR>>

The Ubuntu Artwork team and mailing list serves as a get-together for people who create artwork with and/or for Ubuntu (including the derivatives). Besides great visual design, our interests include the use of Free Software and open processes to get there.

Development of the default wallpaper, GTK themes, and icon sets for Ubuntu are lead by the Canonical Design Team. Xubuntu, Edubuntu, Mythbuntu, Lubuntu and supported packages are open to contributions in these categories.

Concepts going beyond visual design into functionality are better handled by the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Ayatana|Ayatana project]]</nowiki>.

|-
| <style="border:0;"><nowiki>[[File:WarmGreyDot.png]]</nowiki>
| <style="border:0; width:100%;font-weight:bolder;">Participation in upstream open source projects.
|-
| <style="border:0;"><nowiki>[[File:WarmGreyDot.png]]</nowiki>
| <style="border:0; width:100%;font-weight:bolder;">Develop and maintain documentation (here on the wiki)

| <style="border:0;"><nowiki>[[File:WarmGreyDot.png]]</nowiki>

=== Get Involved ===

==== Want to check out the action to see what's going on? ====

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:0;"><nowiki>[[File:WarmGreyDot.png]]</nowiki>
| <style="border:0; width:100%;font-weight:bolder;">The mail list archives are viewable at <nowiki>[[http://www.nabble.com/ubuntu-art-f12728.html|Nabble]]</nowiki>. When you are ready to jump in, subscribe to the Team <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-art|mailing list]]</nowiki>. Choose a normal subscription, not a daily digest, as that makes actually joining discussions much harder.
|}

==== Don't do it alone! ====

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:0;"><nowiki>[[File:WarmGreyDot.png]]</nowiki>
| <style="border:0; width:100%;font-weight:bolder;">Announce your presence by sending an email of introduction to the list describing your experience and interests.
|-
| <style="border:0; padding-left:55px; padding-right:110px;"-2>In order to increase the readability and understanding of email responses please include your comments underneath the sentence/paragraph part-of-the-email you are responding too. Almost all mailers can do this easily. If yours doesn't please take extra attention to doing this by hand.
|-
| <style="border:0;"><nowiki>[[File:WarmGreyDot.png]]</nowiki>
| <style="border:0; width:100%;font-weight:bolder;">To be more connected add an RSS feed. Browser friendly tools are located at http://dir.gmane.org/gmane.linux.ubuntu.artwork .
|}
